thread.title: Paul Golding, Britain First Leader, Yells 'Fuck Off You Foreign C*nt' During London Demo
thread.title_full: Paul Golding, Britain First Leader, Yells 'Fuck Off You Foreign C*nt' During London Demo

author: Chris York
title: Paul Golding, Britain First Leader, Yells 'Fuck Off You Foreign C*nt' During London Demo
text:
Paul Golding, Britain First Leader, Yells 'Fuck Off You Foreign C*nt' During London Demo A man who wants to be taken seriously in politics. 20/03/2017 15:33 Chris York Senior Editor, Huffington Post UK 
Britain First ‚Äôs website has an entire page explaining how the far-right group is ‚Äúpatriotic‚Äù but definitely not racist . Britain First Britain's First website has a page dedicated to racism 
It emphasises: 
'Race' does not feature in our policies or outlook in any way. 
Which makes leader Paul Golding‚Äôs decision to post a video of himself yelling ‚Äúfuck off you fucking foreign c*nt‚Äô on Twitter all the more baffling. I'm in London right now and THIS is what's happening!Britain First vs Antifa scum! pic.twitter.com/rFzu3EaPeL ‚Äî Paul Golding (@GoldingBF) March 18, 2017 
The outburst (about one minute in) came as Golding and a small group of followers were cornered by protestors at Saturday‚Äôs March Against Racism in central London after they attempted to rally against the demo‚Äôs call for unity. 
Golding was among those from the group seen attempting to launch a counter protest, but who later needed to be protected by a line of police officers after chanting: ‚Äú Donald Trump , we love you.‚Äù 
Footage posted to social media appears to show those attending the anti-racism demo shouting at Golding and others holding flags of St George: ‚ÄúNazi scum, off our streets‚Äù. @GoldingBF I love that Paul 'not a racist' Golding recorded a video of him saying something racist and then posted on his own Twitter. üòÖüòÇ 
Golding, who was recently imprisoned for breaching a court order by leading a so-called ‚Äòmosque invasion‚Äô, has political aspirations and stood for London Mayor last year. 
He failed in his bid managing to gain just over one percent of the public vote. 
Golding was then widely ridiculed after turning his back on election winner Sadiq Khan as he made his victory speech. More:
